title: /animated-buttons-when-paused/
content:
Youâ€™ve probably noticed animations are turned off by default on this site. I use freezeframe.js to allow site visitors to turn animations on or off and decided to leave that choice up to each visitor.


	When animations are turned off, only the first frame of an animated .gif file appears. If the name of the site is not present on that first frame, the button appears to be blank (unless hovered). While that may be an intentional design choice on the part of the buttonâ€™s creator, Iâ€™m mentioning it only to be helpful to button creators who may not be aware of how freezeframe and similar solutions render buttons when animations are turned off.


	The simple way to see a buttonâ€™s animation when animations are turned off is to hover your mouse over the button.


	-joe jenett


(cross-posted to mastodon)

title: /scenes-in-a-window/
/my-little-webneko-wins-again/
content:
My finicky friend WebNeko (up there in the left corner) doesnâ€™t always play well with other scripts. At the b22 site, I actually had rebuilt the music section to bring little neko back. Now, here on the neo site, I did away with the Zonelets script, not because I didnâ€™t like it, but because I was able to bring my little buddy back. Yay!

content:
ğ—¯ğ˜‚ğ—¹ğ—¹ğ˜ğ—¼ğ˜„ğ—».ğ—»ğ—²ğ—¼ is 7 days old today. Itâ€™s also my birthday but I stopped counting a long time ago. ğŸ˜


	The original ğ—¯ğ˜‚ğ—¹ğ—¹ğ˜ğ—¼ğ˜„ğ—» goes back some 25 years and was revived in 2022. Versions 3 and 4 are still online, one of which evolved into my current simply. blog.


As the saying goes, this ainâ€™t my first rodeo. I love the web!


Thank you Neocities community - I appreciate those following ğ—¯ğ˜‚ğ—¹ğ—¹ğ˜ğ—¼ğ˜„ğ—».ğ—»ğ—²ğ—¼ and created a little section with your linked buttons on the main page (also at ğ—¯ğ˜‚ğ—¹ğ—¹ğ˜ğ—¼ğ˜„ğ—».ğŸ®ğŸ¬ğŸ®ğŸ®).

title: /what-is-this/
content:
The idea to create bulltown.neo came to me recently as I explored a(nother) newly discovered Neocities site.


As a curator (of sorts) on the web since 1997, Neocities holds a special place in my heart. The personal web is flourishing again and theyâ€™ve played a big part in its revival. Iâ€™m grateful.


So here I am yâ€™all, happy to be a small part of this vibrant community.


Though bulltown lives on my personal domain, weâ€™ve been neighbors for a long time. Nice to meet ya!

title: /welcome/
content:
Iâ€™m working on it - please pardon our dust... ğŸ˜


	Update 09/14/24: The next thing Iâ€™ll be working on here is to add the button wall ('links') and some other homepage stuff. Iâ€™ll be writing soon about why I created this companion site to bulltown here at Neocities.
 I love you guys so please stay tuned as I bring this puppy to life.
	

	–joe jenett
